text: Rion Amilcar Scott is an American short story writer. He won the PEN/Robert W. Bingham Prize for his 2016 book Insurrections. == Life == Scott was born in Washington, D.C. and grew up in Silver Spring, MDEvans, Danielle (2019-09-12), "The Hard, Familiar Truths of Rion Amilcar Scott’s Invented World", Literary Hub. Retrieved 2019-09-12. to parents who are from Trinidad and came to the United States to study at Howard University.. He graduated from George Mason University and teaches at The University of Maryland. == Works == * Insurrections: stories, Lexington, Kentucky: University Press of Kentucky, 2016. , *The World Doesn't Require You, Liveright, 2019. == References == == External links == * Category:Year of birth missing (living people) Category:Living people Category:American male short story writers Category:American people of Trinidad and Tobago descent Category:Bowie State University faculty Category:George Mason University alumni
